p: Challenges of detecting viruses transmitted by the food- and waterborne route are their diversity and the frequent secondary person-to-person transmissions, which may mask an initial food- or waterborne introduction. In addition, there is a lack of awareness among clinicians ( Beersma et al., 2012), as the symptoms caused by foodborne viruses are not specific to the viruses causing the illness. Furthermore, there is limited coverage in surveillance of food- and waterborne viral disease, hampering detecting and tracing ( Ahmed et al., 2014; Verhoef et al., 2015).
